Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in applying the standard of reasonableness to the RPD's findings
Decision_Outcome: RPD rejected refugee claim; RAD initially upheld, then decision set aside
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's credibility was central to RPD's rejection
Legal_Rule: RAD must correct legal errors or palpable and overriding factual errors; not merely apply reasonableness standard
Procedural_Issue: RAD failed to conduct proper appellate review
Grounds_for_Claim: Refugee protection based on fear of persecution
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed by RPD due to credibility issues
Decision_Maker: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Review_Standard: Palpable and overriding error standard should have been applied
Applicant_Challenge: RAD did not properly reassess RPD's credibility findings
Court_Result: Case remitted to a different RAD panel for reconsideration
Outcome: Decision set aside, matter referred back for reevaluation
Remedy_Sought: Overturn RAD decision and remit for new hearing
Legal_Provision: Sections of IRPA governing RAD appeals
Governing_Rule: RAD must conduct de novo review on questions of law and palpable and overriding error on facts
